thread.title: Arsenal's Arsene Wenger set to STAY — even if they miss the Champions League for first time under him
thread.title_full: Arsenal's Arsene Wenger set to STAY — even if they miss the Champions League for first time under him

author: John Cross
title: Arsenal's Arsene Wenger set to STAY — even if they miss the Champions League for first time under him
text:
Sport Arsenal's Arsene Wenger set to STAY — even if they miss the Champions League for first time under him Boss who admits this is his hardest spell since arriving in 1996 doesn't want to go when contract expires in the summer Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger speaks after Arsenal lose 3-1 at West Brom Share this video     
Arsene Wenger has decided he wants to STAY at Arsenal . 
Manager Wenger will have talks with the Gunners' board after admitting publicly that he has made up his mind on his future — although insiders insist no final decision has been taken and no imminent announcement is expected. 
The club say that any decision would have to be a “mutual” one and is not just down to Wenger. 
The futures of star players Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez could have a huge impact on that outcome. 
However, there is mystery surrounding Ozil. It had been thought Wenger would walk if Arsenal missed out on the top four, but... (Photo: Getty) 
The Germany international midfielder trained on Friday, but then did not travel for the next day's defeat at West Brom because Wenger said he had a “hamstring” injury. 
Arsenal players were not sure from the final training session, when they practise team shape, as to whether Ozil would have started at the Hawthorns. 
But the 28-year-old is still expected to report for international duty, including Wednesday’s friendly with England in Dortmund. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Alan Shearer SLAMS 'embarrassing' Arsenal players Share this video Watch Next 
Arsenal insist Ozil did not complete Friday’s session and had treatment over the weekend. 
Ozil’s future is another worry for Wenger, who could lose him and Chile forward Sanchez this summer as both only have 15 months left on their contracts. 
It is believed the representatives of Sanchez and Ozil have got together and both demanded deals worth in excess of £300,000-a-week. 
They are not budging, which means they are likely to be off. Ozil at Friday training — Arsenal say he didn't finish the session and didn't take him to West Brom (Photo: Arsenal/Getty) Sanchez DID play on Saturday but picked up a worrying injury and had to go off (Photo: Arsenal/Getty) 
West Brom boss Tony Pulis thinks Wenger will stay at the Emirates. 
After the Baggies' 3-1 victory at the weekend, Pulis said: “I’ll be surprised if he goes.” 
Asked if that is because the Frenchman had told him, he replied, “Yeah, because he told me.” 
A growing proportion of Arsenal fans are demanding change when Wenger’s contract expires this summer, and the club are acutely aware that it will not be a universally popular decision. A plane flew over the stadium expressing the views of many Arsenal fans... (Photo: Getty) ...but another aircraft showed there are still Wenger loyalists too (Photo: REUTERS) 
The Gunners are facing the prospect of missing out on the top four for the first time in the manager's 20-plus years in charge, and the FA Cup — where they have reached the semi-finals — is their only last hope of silverware this season. 
They are likely to demand a major shake-up behind the scenes, with the long-term future of transfer fixer Dick Law uncertain and the search underway for a new Academy director. Four defeats in five league games have Arsenal sitting sixth with 11 matches to go (Photo: REUTERS) 
Arsenal know that if Wenger does sign a new two-year deal, they will have to get the timing of the announcement right — especially if Ozil and Sanchez are sold. 
Mirror Sport understands the 67-year-old retains the support of the dressing room, but there is concern about the uncertainty of his future coupled with rock-bottom confidence after poor recent results. 
There was a belief that Wenger would go if the Gunners missed out on qualification for next season's Champions League, but that is no longer necessarily the case. Like us on Facebook
